title: Atomic Layer Deposition (ALD) Process
description: A schema representing the detailed steps and parameters involved in the ALD process, including the deposition of various metals using different techniques.

ALDMethod.description: The specific ALD technique used, such as thermal ALD or plasma-enhanced ALD, detailing the advantages and typical use cases of each.

MaterialDeposited.description: The material being deposited, e.g., cobalt (Co), lithium cobalt oxide (LiCoO2), gallium oxide (Ga2O3), platinum (Pt), ruthenium (Ru), silicon nitride (SiNx).

Dopants.description: List of dopants used in the ALD process, detailing their types, concentrations, and effects on the material properties.

type.description: Type of dopant, e.g., Fe, Co, Ni.

concentration.description: Concentration of the dopant in the film.

effects.description: Effects of the dopant on material properties such as magneto-optical and ferroelectric properties.

MagnetoOpticalProperties.description: Properties related to the magneto-optical effects of the film.

KerrAngle.description: Kerr angle observed in the film.

FerroelectricProperties.description: Properties related to the ferroelectric behavior of the film.

SwitchablePolarization.description: Indicates if the film exhibits switchable polarization.

DepositionDetails.description: Detailed steps and conditions used in the deposition process.

PrecursorPulseDuration.description: Duration of the precursor pulse in seconds.

OxidantPulseDuration.description: Duration of the oxidant pulse in seconds.

CycleDetails.description: Details about the deposition cycles, including number of cycles and sequence.
